meta.title: A Court of Mist and Fury
meta.author: Sarah J. Maas

1.description: Now High Fae, struggling with trauma from Under the Mountain. Suffers from nightmares and refuses to eat or paint.

8.description: Begins training with Rhysand in the Night Court, learning to read and control her new High Fae powers.

20.description: Discovers she's Rhysand's mate, not Tamlin's. Learns about the true nature of the mating bond.

35.description: Accepts the mating bond with Rhysand and becomes High Lady of the Night Court, the first of her kind.

45.description: Uses her growing powers to help protect the Night Court and prepares for the coming war.

55.description: Fully embraces her role as High Lady and partner to Rhysand, ready to face whatever challenges come next.

7.description: Takes Feyre to the Night Court to honor their bargain. Shows her the true beauty of his realm, not the darkness others assume.

12.description: Reveals his Inner Circle - Cassian, Azriel, Morrigan, and Amren. Shows Feyre she's not alone.

20.description: Reveals he's known Feyre was his mate since Under the Mountain but waited for her to choose freely.

30.description: Shows Feyre the Court of Dreams - his vision of what the Night Court could be with equality and hope.

35.description: Accepts Feyre's acceptance of the mating bond and makes her High Lady of the Night Court, sharing his power equally.

50.description: Prepares for war against Hybern while building alliances with other courts. Shows his strategic mind.

1.description: Overprotective of Feyre after their trauma Under the Mountain. Keeps her confined and makes decisions for her.

4.description: Becomes increasingly possessive and angry, lashing out with his powers when Feyre tries to assert independence.

24.description: Tracks Feyre to the Night Court and demands her return, unable to accept her choice to leave.

52.description: Makes a deal with the King of Hybern to get Feyre back, betraying the Night Court and his former allies.

8.description: Powerful Illyrian warrior with massive wings and battle-worn hands. General of Rhysand's armies and part of his Inner Circle.

12.description: Shows his protective nature toward the Inner Circle and his fierce loyalty to Rhysand. Has a playful, teasing personality.

25.description: Helps train Feyre in combat, showing patience and skill as a teacher. Becomes like a brother to her.

40.description: Reveals more of his past as a bastard-born Illyrian who earned his place through skill and determination.

8.description: Mysterious Illyrian with scarred hands who controls shadows. Serves as Rhysand's spymaster and intelligence gatherer.

15.description: Quiet and observant, prefers to listen and watch. His shadows bring him information from across the courts.

28.description: Shows his scarred hands were burned as a child by his father and stepbrothers, explaining his withdrawn nature.

8.description: Beautiful blonde faerie with golden-brown eyes. Third in command of the Night Court and fiercely loyal to Rhysand.

18.description: Reveals she's from the Court of Nightmares but chose Rhysand's side. Has complicated family history in Hewn City.
18.role: Exile from family, Chosen family member

32.description: Shows her power over truth - she can sense lies and compel honesty. Uses this ability to serve the court.

9.description: Ancient being trapped in High Fae form with silver eyes. Incredibly powerful and dangerous, serves as Rhysand's second.

16.description: Reveals she's not originally from this world but was trapped here. Desperately wants to return to her true form.

35.description: Shows genuine care for the Inner Circle despite her harsh exterior. Values their chosen family.

1.description: Struggling to balance his loyalty to Tamlin with his growing concern for Feyre's wellbeing.

5.description: Tries to reason with Tamlin about his controlling behavior but is largely ignored or dismissed.

53.description: Discovers Elain Archeron is his mate when she's transformed into High Fae, changing everything for him.

13.description: Living in the new estate Feyre provided, but struggling with the family's changed circumstances and Feyre's absence.

22.description: Shows fierce protectiveness when the King of Hybern threatens her family, revealing hidden depths.

52.description: Forcibly transformed into High Fae by the King of Hybern using the Cauldron. Emerges with unknown new powers.

13.description: Thriving in the family's new wealth, tending elaborate gardens and planning her wedding to Graysen.

22.description: Shows unexpected courage when faced with the King of Hybern, standing with her sisters despite her gentle nature.

52.description: Forcibly transformed into High Fae by the Cauldron. Emerges as a Seer with prophetic abilities.

22.description: Ancient and powerful faerie king who seeks to reclaim the human lands and destroy the Wall between realms.

50.description: Reveals his plan to use the Cauldron to break the Wall and enslave humanity once more.

52.description: Demonstrates his power by forcibly transforming Nesta and Elain into High Fae using the Cauldron.

35.description: Ancient magical artifact of immense power, considered the source of all life and magic in the world.

50.description: Controlled by the King of Hybern to reshape the world according to his desires. Can transform and create.

52.description: Forces the transformation of Nesta and Elain into High Fae, giving them new powers and immortality.

2.description: High Priestess who comes to the Spring Court, seemingly to help Feyre adjust but with hidden motives.

6.description: Encourages Tamlin's protective behavior and isolation of Feyre, claiming it's for her own good.

52.description: Revealed to be working with the King of Hybern all along, betraying the Spring Court for power.

33.description: Young High Lord of Summer with blue-green hair and sea-colored eyes. Rules from the beautiful Summer Court palace.

38.description: Shows his generous nature by sharing his court's knowledge and resources freely with visitors.

42.description: Feels betrayed when he discovers Feyre and Rhysand stole from his court, despite their good intentions.

33.description: Prince of Adriata and Tarquin's cousin, with the same blue-green coloring. Warrior and protector of Summer Court.

38.description: Shows interest in Amren despite her dangerous nature, seeing something others miss.

33.description: Princess of Adriata and Varian's sister, with flowing blue-green hair and the beauty of the Summer Court.

46.description: High Lord of Dawn with healing powers and golden-brown skin. Hosts the meeting of High Lords to discuss the Hybern threat.
High Lord of Day with golden hair and bronze skin. Known for his libraries and vast knowledge.
Cold and cruel High Lord of Autumn with fire powers. Lucien's father who cast him out.
46.role: High Lord, Cruel father, Fire wielder

46.description: Beautiful but subdued wife of Beron, with the same red hair as Lucien. Clearly under her husband's control.
High Lord of Winter with silver hair and ice-blue eyes. Rules the Winter Court with his mate.
Kallias's mate and Lady of Winter, with snow-white hair and fierce blue eyes. Co-rules Winter Court.
Beron's eldest son and heir to the Autumn Court. Cruel and ambitious like his father.

52.description: Ancient human commander resurrected by the King of Hybern from his eye. Confused and disoriented by his return.

13.description: Much improved in health and spirits thanks to Feyre's wealth. Working to rebuild his business connections.

22.description: Shows courage when the King of Hybern threatens his family, despite his physical limitations.

13.description: Now married to Elain and living in their new estate. Has gained a lordship through the family's new wealth.

54.description: Horrified and disgusted when he discovers Elain has been transformed into High Fae, rejecting her completely.

18.description: Steward of the Court of Nightmares and Mor's father. Cold and calculating ruler of Hewn City.

28.description: Despises his daughter Mor for her choices and works against Rhysand whenever possible.

18.description: Dark faeries who live in Hewn City and represent the old, cruel ways of the Night Court.

26.description: Ancient and dangerous creature who weaves with magical thread. Lives alone and is extremely territorial.

27.description: Feyre successfully retrieves an item from her lair, proving her courage and cunning.

11.description: Ancient and terrifying creature imprisoned in the deepest levels of the Night Court library.

44.description: Reveals more of its nature as an entity from another realm, similar to Amren but more dangerous.

23.description: Ancient faerie creature that must answer questions truthfully when caught. Feyre consults it for advice.

24.description: Gives Feyre crucial information about Rhysand and warns her about the coming dangers.

1.description: Various lesser faeries who serve in Tamlin's manor, now free from Amarantha's curse but still bound to serve.
Faerie warriors who patrol and protect the Spring Court borders and manor.

8.description: Happy and well-treated servants who work in the Night Court by choice, not compulsion.
Happy, thriving faeries who live in the beautiful city of Velaris. Artists, merchants, families living in peace.

25.description: Warrior race with bat-like wings who serve the Night Court. Traditional and often resistant to change.

40.description: Many still practice brutal traditions like wing-clipping of females, which the Inner Circle opposes.
Female Illyrians who are often denied training and have their wings clipped to prevent them from flying.

10.description: Friendly tavern owner in Velaris who runs a popular establishment frequented by the Inner Circle.

11.description: Head librarian of the Night Court's vast library. Ancient and wise keeper of knowledge.

33.description: Warriors who protect the Summer Court and its beautiful coastal cities like Adriata.
Happy citizens of the Summer Court who live in beautiful coastal cities and enjoy their court's prosperity.

46.description: Citizens of the Dawn Court known for their healing arts and peaceful nature.
Scholarly citizens of the Day Court who value knowledge and learning above all.
Citizens who live under Beron's harsh rule in the Autumn Court, often fearful and oppressed.
Hardy citizens of the Winter Court who thrive under the equal rule of Kallias and Viviane.

48.description: Powerful faerie warriors who serve the King of Hybern in his quest to reclaim the human lands.

50.description: High-ranking military commanders who lead the King of Hybern's forces in battle.

13.description: Powerful mortal rulers who govern the human lands and control access across the Wall.

50.description: Some ally with Hybern in exchange for promises of immortality and power.

13.description: Mortal warriors who serve the human queens and defend the human lands from faerie threats.
Mortal traders who conduct business across the human lands and sometimes near the Wall.
Common mortal people who live in villages and towns throughout the human lands.
Magical beings and constructs that maintain and guard the Wall between human and faerie realms.

35.description: Primordial spirits and entities that have existed since the world's creation, connected to the Cauldron.
Magical items created by the Cauldron's power, possessing immense magical abilities.

2.description: Religious figures who serve various temples and provide spiritual guidance to the courts.
Warriors who protect temples and religious sites throughout the various courts.

8.description: Talented artists, painters, sculptors, and craftspeople who make Velaris the City of Starlight beautiful.
Prosperous traders and shopkeepers who conduct business in the thriving markets of Velaris.
Happy children who grow up safely in Velaris, representing the peace and prosperity of the city.
Happy families who live peacefully in Velaris, showing what the Night Court can be at its best.

10.description: Skilled healers who practice medicine and healing arts throughout the various courts.

11.description: Learned individuals who study history, magic, and lore in libraries throughout the courts.
Dedicated keepers of books and knowledge who maintain the great libraries of the courts.

15.description: Secret agents who gather information for various courts and rulers throughout the realm.

20.description: Skilled killers who work in secret for various courts and causes throughout the realm.

28.description: Those who resist oppressive rule and fight for change in courts like the Court of Nightmares.

40.description: People displaced by war and conflict who seek safety in other courts and territories.

13.description: Fast and reliable carriers of messages between courts, cities, and important figures.

8.description: Merchants and traders who facilitate commerce between courts and communities.
Skilled artisans who create beautiful and useful items for their communities.

13.description: Those who grow food and tend the land to feed the populations of various courts.

33.description: Those who harvest the sea for food, especially common in coastal areas like the Summer Court.
Skilled craftspeople who build ships and boats for transportation and trade.
Experienced travelers of the sea who navigate ships and conduct maritime trade.

40.description: Hardy people who live in mountainous regions, often including Illyrian camps.

1.description: People who live in and around forests, often in harmony with nature and woodland creatures.

8.description: One of Rhysand's personal servants, a wraith with the ability to move unseen and unheard.
One of Rhysand's personal servants, a wraith with the ability to move unseen and unheard.

25.description: Harsh camp lord of Windhaven, traditionalist who opposes female training and modern changes to Illyrian ways.
Illyrian female who runs a supply shop, dreams of flying despite wing-clipping traditions.

12.description: Renowned painter in Velaris known for her vivid landscape paintings of the Night Court's mountains.
Curator of the main art gallery in Velaris, helps display and sell local artists' works.

13.description: Beautiful singer who performs at Rita's and other venues, known for her haunting ballads.

14.description: Master jewelry craftsman who creates exquisite pieces worn by Night Court nobles.

10.description: Florist in Velaris who tends the city's gardens and creates beautiful flower arrangements.

11.description: Skilled book binder who creates and repairs books in Velaris, works with the library.

10.description: Beloved baker in Velaris who makes the city's finest bread and pastries.

12.description: Wine merchant who imports the finest wines from across Prythian for Velaris.

14.description: Talented seamstress who creates beautiful clothing for Night Court citizens.

33.description: Captain who manages the Summer Court's main harbor and oversees maritime trade.
Beautiful sea-fae who sings for Tarquin's court, her voice can calm storms.

2.description: Lead captain of Tamlin's guard, enforces the High Lord's increasingly strict rules.

1.description: Spring Court sentry who was killed by Feyre while in wolf form, his death still haunts her.

46.description: High Lord of the Autumn Court, father to Eris and other sons, rules with an iron fist.

33.description: Young High Lord of the Summer Court, fair and just ruler who welcomes allies.

46.description: Charismatic High Lord of the Day Court, master of light magic and ancient knowledge.
High Lord of the Winter Court, recently freed from Under the Mountain's curse.
Kind High Lord of the Dawn Court, skilled healer and peacemaker.

11.description: Ancient and skilled healer who serves the Night Court, tends to injuries and illnesses.

1.description: Kind-hearted Spring Court servant who genuinely cares for Feyre's wellbeing.

41.description: Ancient being imprisoned in the Prison, can see death and take any shape.
Terrifying ancient creature imprisoned in the Prison, made of shadow and nightmare.

35.description: Former human queen who became immortal, now rules hidden island kingdom with Prince Drakon.
Noble Seraphim prince with great wings, rules hidden island kingdom with Miryam.

27.description: Ancient, deadly creature living in a cottage who weaves fate itself into her tapestries.

41.description: Ancient being imprisoned in the Prison, brother to the Bone Carver, equally feared.

46.description: Wife of Lord Beron, mother to Eris and his brothers, suffers under her husband's rule.
Beloved mate of Kallias, helped him through the curse of Under the Mountain.

33.description: Princess of the Summer Court, sister to Tarquin, wise and diplomatic.
Prince cousin to Tarquin, skilled warrior and loyal friend to the High Lord.

7.description: Innocent human girl who was tortured and killed by Amarantha as punishment meant for Feyre.

13.description: Human lord, father to Graysen, owns estate where Archeron family now lives.

33.description: Captain who manages the Summer Court's main harbor and oversees maritime trade.
Beautiful sea-fae who sings for Tarquin's court, her voice can calm storms.

2.description: Lead captain of Tamlin's guard, enforces the High Lord's increasingly strict rules.

1.description: Spring Court sentry who was killed by Feyre while in wolf form, his death still haunts her.
Kind-hearted Spring Court servant who genuinely cares for Feyre's wellbeing.

33.description: Children of the Summer Court who play in the waters and learn swimming from birth.

relationships.Water: Born to love and swim in

17.description: Elite spies who work for Rhysand, gathering intelligence across Prythian.

18.description: Cruel nobles of the Court of Nightmares who rule through fear and tradition.

1.description: Guards stationed at the Wall between human and faerie lands, maintain the border.

13.description: Friendly staff who work at Rita's tavern, serving drinks and creating atmosphere.

10.description: Various shop owners who run the thriving businesses throughout Velaris.

25.description: Master blacksmiths who forge weapons and tools for the Illyrian warrior camps.
Mothers in Illyrian camps who raise children under harsh traditional rules.

29.description: Leader among the human queens, makes final decisions for their group.
Wise advisor among the human queens, counsels on important decisions.
Most martial of the human queens, focuses on military strategy and defense.
Most learned of the human queens, studies magic and ancient knowledge.
Youngest of the human queens, often questions traditional approaches.
Most diplomatic of the human queens, handles negotiations and treaties.

33.description: Skilled fishermen who harvest the seas around the Summer Court's coastline.
Expert divers who harvest pearls and treasures from the ocean depths.
Master craftsmen who build the beautiful ships of the Summer Court fleet.

41.description: Ancient keeper of the Prison who guards the most dangerous creatures in Prythian.

50.description: Ancient maidens bound to serve and protect the Cauldron's power.

1.description: Workers who maintain the beautiful gardens and grounds of the Spring Court manor.

11.description: Educators who teach reading, writing, and other skills to Night Court citizens.

10.description: Talented performers who entertain crowds in the streets and squares of Velaris.

41.description: Primordial spirits that existed before the current age, hold ancient knowledge.

25.description: Veteran Illyrian warrior who trained Cassian and Azriel, respects their skills.

46.description: Secret agents who serve Lord Beron and report on activities across courts.
Elite guards of the Winter Court, masters of ice magic and cold weather combat.
Learned scholars who preserve ancient knowledge in the Day Court's vast libraries.
Master healers trained in the Dawn Court's healing arts under Thesan.

48.description: Loyal servants who serve the King of Hybern and carry out his dark commands.

1.description: Noble families who serve under Tamlin's rule in the Spring Court.

25.description: Elderly Illyrians who remember old traditions and advise camp leaders.
Hardy cooks who prepare simple but nourishing meals for the warrior camps.

10.description: Dedicated gardeners who maintain the beautiful parks and green spaces of Velaris.
Skilled architects who designed and built the beautiful structures of Velaris.

12.description: Talented musicians who perform throughout Velaris, creating the city's vibrant cultural life.

13.description: Graceful dancers who perform at celebrations and entertainment venues in Velaris.

11.description: Learned librarians who maintain the vast libraries of the Night Court.

7.description: Deceased sorceress who once ruled Under the Mountain and cursed the Spring Court, killed by Feyre.

1.description: Musicians who play at Spring Court celebrations and ceremonies.

30.description: Citizens who share Rhysand's dream of a better Night Court built on hope and freedom.

18.description: Brutal guards who enforce order in the Court of Nightmares through violence.

1.description: Guards who patrol the Spring Court borders and protect Tamlin's territory.

15.description: Secret contacts who provide Lucien with information about court politics and movements.

22.description: Military commanders who serve Rhysand and lead the Night Court's armies.

52.description: Creatures transformed or created by the Cauldron's power, including the changed Archeron sisters.

recaps.1: Feyre struggles with trauma from Under the Mountain, unable to eat, paint, or function normally despite being in the Spring Court.
recaps.2: Tamlin becomes increasingly overprotective and controlling, making all decisions for Feyre and keeping her confined to the manor.
recaps.3: The High Priestess Ianthe arrives, seemingly to help but actually encouraging Tamlin's possessive behavior toward Feyre.
recaps.4: Feyre's mental state deteriorates as she feels trapped and powerless, while Tamlin's anger and magic become increasingly volatile.
recaps.5: Lucien tries to reason with Tamlin about his treatment of Feyre, but his concerns are dismissed and ignored.
recaps.6: Feyre realizes she's becoming a prisoner rather than a partner, as Tamlin makes plans for their wedding without consulting her.
recaps.7: Rhysand arrives to collect on his bargain, taking Feyre to the Night Court for one week per month as agreed.
recaps.8: Feyre discovers the true beauty of the Night Court and meets Rhysand's Inner Circle - Cassian, Azriel, and Morrigan.
recaps.9: Rhysand introduces Feyre to Amren, an ancient and powerful being who serves as his second-in-command.
recaps.10: Feyre begins to heal emotionally as she explores Velaris, the City of Starlight, and rediscovers her love of art.
recaps.11: Training begins as Feyre learns to read properly and starts developing her High Fae powers under careful guidance.
recaps.12: The Inner Circle becomes like a family to Feyre, showing her what healthy relationships and mutual respect look like.
recaps.13: Feyre visits her human family to check on them, finding them prosperous and well in their new estate.
recaps.14: Her sisters react differently to Feyre's transformation - Elain with acceptance, Nesta with suspicion and anger.
recaps.15: Feyre learns more about the political situation between courts and the growing threat from the King of Hybern.
recaps.16: Time in the Night Court helps Feyre understand herself better and begin to process her trauma healthily.
recaps.17: Rhysand shares more of his past and the burdens of leadership, showing his true character beyond the mask.
recaps.18: Feyre visits the Court of Nightmares in Hewn City, seeing the darker side of the Night Court that Rhysand rules.
recaps.19: The contrast between Hewn City and Velaris shows Feyre how complex leadership can be and the masks rulers must wear.
recaps.20: Rhysand reveals that Feyre is his true mate, not Tamlin's, and that he's known since Under the Mountain.
recaps.21: Feyre processes this revelation and begins to understand the difference between the mating bond and true partnership.
recaps.22: The King of Hybern makes his move, threatening war and seeking to reclaim the human lands beyond the Wall.
recaps.23: Feyre consults the Suriel for advice about the growing threats and her complicated feelings.
recaps.24: Tamlin tracks Feyre to the Night Court, demanding her return and refusing to accept her choice to stay.
recaps.25: Training intensifies as Feyre learns combat skills from Cassian and begins to master her growing powers.
recaps.26: A dangerous mission to retrieve a magical item tests Feyre's courage and proves her growing strength.
recaps.27: Feyre successfully completes her trial against the Weaver, showing her development into a true warrior.
recaps.28: Political tensions rise as courts choose sides, with some supporting Hybern and others opposing the coming war.
recaps.29: Rhysand and Feyre work together to build alliances, their partnership growing stronger and more equal.
recaps.30: The Court of Dreams is revealed - Rhysand's vision of what the Night Court could become with hope and equality.
recaps.31: Feyre fully embraces her role in the Night Court and her partnership with Rhysand as they face the future together.
recaps.32: Plans are made for the coming conflict as intelligence reports suggest Hybern's invasion is imminent.
recaps.33: Diplomatic missions begin as Feyre and Rhysand visit the Summer Court to seek allies against Hybern.
recaps.34: Tarquin and his court welcome them warmly, showing the beauty and openness of the Summer Court.
recaps.35: Feyre learns about the Cauldron and other magical artifacts that could tip the balance of the coming war.
recaps.36: A secret mission to acquire a powerful artifact tests the growing trust between the Night Court and Summer Court.
recaps.37: The mission succeeds but at the cost of damaging relationships, showing the difficult choices war demands.
recaps.38: Consequences of their actions strain alliances as other courts question the Night Court's methods.
recaps.39: Feyre struggles with the moral complexities of war and the difficult decisions required to protect those she loves.
recaps.40: Training continues as Feyre learns about Illyrian culture and the challenges facing the Night Court's warriors.
recaps.41: The reality of inequality and oppression within their own territories becomes clear, adding internal conflicts.
recaps.42: Betrayal and shifting loyalties complicate efforts to build a united front against the King of Hybern.
recaps.43: Feyre's powers continue to grow as she learns to access magic from all seven courts through her unusual heritage.
recaps.44: Ancient knowledge and dangerous creatures become allies as desperate times require unprecedented alliances.
recaps.45: Feyre proves herself in battle and politics, earning respect as both warrior and leader in her own right.
recaps.46: A gathering of High Lords attempts to create a united front, but old grudges and fears threaten cooperation.
recaps.47: Difficult negotiations reveal the depth of mistrust between courts and the challenge of building lasting alliances.
recaps.48: The King of Hybern's true plans become clear as he moves to break the Wall between human and faerie realms.
recaps.49: Time runs short as Hybern's forces gather, making war inevitable despite all attempts at peaceful resolution.
recaps.50: The Cauldron's power is revealed to be the key to Hybern's plans for reshaping the world according to his vision.
recaps.51: Feyre's family becomes directly threatened as the conflict escalates beyond the faerie realm into human lands.
recaps.52: The King of Hybern demonstrates his power by forcibly transforming Nesta and Elain into High Fae using the Cauldron.
recaps.53: Shocking revelations about mating bonds emerge as Lucien discovers his connection to the transformed Elain.
recaps.54: The transformation's aftermath reveals new powers in the Archeron sisters but also destroys Elain's human life.
recaps.55: War becomes inevitable as all attempts at peace fail, and Feyre must fully embrace her role as High Lady to protect everyone she loves.
